ygData.subject: Re: Placement of conceptually different inputs in HyperNEAT?
ygData.msgSnippet: I guess that Ken is able to give you the correct answer about this issue. My point is that 2D is a subspace of 3D and therefore the CPPN should always take 3D

I guess that Ken is able to give you the correct answer about this 
issue. =

My point is that 2D is a subspace of 3D and therefore the CPPN should 
alw=
ays take 3D points as input if some part of the substrate is 3D. 

Peter

-=
